rows: A 19-year-old buys a second-hand motorcycle. His parents don't approve.
A 17-year-old girl buys a new e-bike for CHF 5000. She wants to pay off the purchase price in 24 installments in addition to a down payment. Her parents refuse the purchase.
A 17-year-old girl buys a second-hand e-bike for CHF 1000 from the savings on her apprenticeship wages.
A 15-year-old receives a new e-bike worth CHF 5000 as a gift from her godmother.
A 9-year-old uses her pocket money to buy an ice cream at the swimming pool.
A 17-year-old girl buys a new e-bike for CHF 5000. She wants to pay off the purchase price in 24 installments in addition to a down payment. Her parents agree to the purchase.
An 85-year-old man is placed under comprehensive guardianship due to his dementia. He donates his art collection to his neighbor.
